alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:26AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Aroostook County through 900 AM EDT... At 725 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms near Saint Pamphile, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Deboullie Mountain, Saint Pamphile, Portage Lake, New Canada, Allagash Township, Fish River Lake, Dickey, Wallagrass, Winterville, Saint Francis, Soldier Pond and Saint John. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Fort Kent. State Highway 11 between Winterville and Fort Kent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
